titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford University Radical Movement Collection
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives
publicationstmt.p: Copyright © 2015 The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Publications, reports and booklets documenting the radical movement at Stanford University.
did.physloc: Special Collections and University Archives materials are stored offsite and must be paged 36-48 hours in advance. For more information on paging collections, see the department's website: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/spc.html.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94305-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Stanford University Radical Movement Collection (SC1102). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of publications, reports and booklets documenting the radical movement at Stanford University.

did.unittitle: Barnett, Clifford et al, “I. Stanford and the Nuremberg Principles” and “II. Aspects of Complicity of Stanford University in the War”

scopecontent.p: A forum for controversial issues of special interest to the Engineering Community--sponsored by the Student-Faculty Liaison Committee of the School of Engineering.

did.unittitle: Gregory, George et al, “Report of the Ad Hoc Committee on Protection of Privacy of Information at Stanford”
Clark, Ramsey, Ellsberg, Daniel et al, "Might vs Right in America: A Conference at Stanford University"
